revised_title: On the Dilatational Stability of the Earth: A Reassessment of Elasticity and Hydrostatic Pressure
tldr: The author argues that the traditional elastic theory can be applied to matter in a state of stress, provided that altered values of elasticities are allowed. This challenges the notion that bodies under great hydrostatic pressure cannot be treated using elastic theory, and suggests that the rigidity of the Earth's interior may be increased under such conditions.
